Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.index

Interface IndexAccessor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, ConsistencyCheckable, IndexConfigProvider, MinimalIndexAccessor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLuceneIndexAccessor, FulltextIndexAccessor, FusionIndexAccessor, GenericNativeIndexAccessor, IndexAccessor.Adapter, IndexAccessor.Delegating, LuceneIndexAccessor, NativeIndexAccessor
    public interface IndexAccessor
extends Closeable, ConsistencyCheckable, MinimalIndexAccessor
    Used for online operation of an index.

    • Field Detail

      • UNKNOWN_NUMBER_OF_ENTRIES

        static final long UNKNOWN_NUMBER_OF_ENTRIES

    • Method Detail

      • newUpdater

        IndexUpdater newUpdater​(IndexUpdateMode mode,
                        PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Return an updater for applying a set of changes to this index. Updates must be visible in readers created after this update.

        This is called with IndexUpdateMode.RECOVERY when starting up after a crash or similar. Updates given then may have already been applied to this index, so additional checks must be in place so that data doesn't get duplicated, but is idempotent.

      • force

        void force​(IOLimiter ioLimiter,
           PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Forces this index to disk. Called at certain points from within Neo4j for example when rotating the logical log. After completion of this call there cannot be any essential state that hasn't been forced to disk.
        Parameters:
        ioLimiter - The IOLimiter to use for implementations living on top of PageCache.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Throws:
        UncheckedIOException - if there was a problem forcing the state to persistent storage.

      • refresh

        void refresh()
        Refreshes this index, so that readers created after completion of this call will see the latest updates. This happens automatically on closing newUpdater(IndexUpdateMode, PageCursorTracer) w/ IndexUpdateMode.ONLINE, but not guaranteed for IndexUpdateMode.RECOVERY. Therefore this call is complementary for updates that has taken place with IndexUpdateMode.RECOVERY.
        Throws:
        UncheckedIOException - if there was a problem refreshing the index.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this index accessor. There will not be any interactions after this call. After completion of this call there cannot be any essential state that hasn't been forced to disk.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Throws:
        UncheckedIOException - if unable to close index.

      • newReader

        IndexReader newReader()
        Returns:
        a new IndexReader responsible for looking up results in the index. The returned reader must honor repeatable reads.

      • newAllEntriesReader

        default BoundedIterable<Long> newAllEntriesReader​(PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Parameters:
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Returns:
        a BoundedIterable to access all entity ids indexed in this index.

      • newAllEntriesReader

        BoundedIterable<Long> newAllEntriesReader​(long fromIdInclusive,
                                          long toIdExclusive,
                                          PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Parameters:
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Returns:
        a BoundedIterable to access all entity ids indexed in the range fromIdInclusive-toIdExclusive in this index.

      • newAllIndexEntriesReader

        default IndexEntriesReader[] newAllIndexEntriesReader​(int partitions,
                                                      PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Returns one or more readers reading all entries in this index. The supplied partitions is a hint for how many readers the caller wants back, each reader only reading a part of the whole index. The returned readers can be read individually in parallel and collectively all partitions will read all the index entries in this index.
        Parameters:
        partitions - a hint for how many partitions will be returned.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Returns:
        the partitions that can read the index entries in this index. The implementation should strive to adhere to this number, but the only real contract is that the returned number of readers is between 1 <= numberOfReturnedReaders <= partitions.

      • snapshotFiles

        ResourceIterator<Path> snapshotFiles()
        Should return a full listing of all files needed by this index accessor to work with the index. The files need to remain available until the resource iterator returned here is closed. This is used to duplicate created indexes across clusters, among other things.

      • verifyDeferredConstraints

        void verifyDeferredConstraints​(NodePropertyAccessor nodePropertyAccessor)
                        throws IndexEntryConflictException
        Verifies that each value in this index is unique. Index is guaranteed to not change while this call executes.
        Parameters:
        nodePropertyAccessor - NodePropertyAccessor for accessing properties from database storage in the event of conflicting values.
        Throws:
        IndexEntryConflictException - for first detected uniqueness conflict, if any.
        UncheckedIOException - on error reading from source files.

      • validateBeforeCommit

        default void validateBeforeCommit​(long entityId,
                                  Value[] tuple)
        Validates the value tuple before transaction determines that it can commit.

      • estimateNumberOfEntries

        long estimateNumberOfEntries​(PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Parameters:
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Returns:
        an estimate of the number of entries, i.e. entityId+values pairs, in this index, or UNKNOWN_NUMBER_OF_ENTRIES if number of entries couldn't be determined.
